meanings.definition: Not able to be done or carried out.
meanings.sent1: The broken machine was unwork and needed repair.
meanings.sent2: The unwork puzzle was missing a crucial piece.
meanings.sent3: The unwork plan to build a house out of candy was quickly abandoned.
meanings.sent4: Her unwork attempt to juggle flaming torches ended in disaster.
meanings.sent5: The unwork bridge collapsed under the weight of the heavy truck.

meanings.definition: To fail to function properly or effectively.
meanings.sent1: The old computer began to unwork after years of use.
meanings.sent2: The plan to unwork the stubborn knot was successful with patience.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to unwork the math problem by guessing wildly was not successful.
meanings.sent4: The engine started to unwork just when they needed it the most.
meanings.sent5: The potion had a strange effect, causing things to unwork instead of work properly.
